source:
manuel pellegrini has admitted he is disappointed in yaya toure but vowed to back the manchester city midfielder -- at least until the end of the season .
sportsmail revealed city would listen to offers for the ivorian as they look to overhaul an ageing squad at the end of a faltering campaign .
toure is determined not to be forced out but the chilean , speaking ahead of sunday 's visit of west ham , acknowledged the midfielder had underperformed and dismissed claims he should be given a rest .
manchester city midfielder yaya toure has come in for criticism for his performances this season
manuel pellegrini has admitted he has been disappointed by the ivory coast midfielder 's level
` i do n't think he 's happy with his performance this year -- and nor am i , ' said pellegrini .
` he does n't need a break . '
toure , who has two years left on a £ 220,000-a-week deal , has come in for criticism amid the collapse of city 's premier league defence .
but pellegrini , who faces questions over his own future , said the 31-year-old would be backed .
` he 's a very important player and he will have my support until the end of the season , ' he said .
city , who have taken just 18 points from the last available 39 , take on sam allardyce 's side knowing that defeat will leave fifth-placed liverpool with the chance to close the gap to one point with victory at west brom next weekend .
city will also face the hammers without captain vincent kompany , who could miss the rest of the campaign with a muscle injury .
with his manager in the firing line , city goalkeeper joe hart insisted the players should take responsibility .
` people have been disappointed in their own performances , ' said the england no 1 .
` we 've let the manager down a few times and we 've baffled ourselves because we feel like we 've got the quality to beat anyone and that 's not been the case . '
city boss pellegrini has vowed to support toure until at least the end of the season
sportsmail revealed that manchester city will listen to offers for toure in the summer
hart added that pellegrini retained the backing of the dressing room .
` he 's been great , ' hart said .
` he 's hard , he kind of says it how it is and you ca n't ask for much more than that from a manager . '
pellegrini , however , said : ` the players have responsibility but i choose the players . '
meanwhile sam allardyce has warned aaron cresswell not to make the same mistake as others amid interest from chelsea and manchester city .
manchester city want to sign west ham left back aaron cresswell in the summer
sam allardyce has warned cresswell not to make same mistake as other english players by moving to city
allardyce believes the 25-year-old is an attractive prospect after a fine season at west ham and because he can help clubs fill homegrown player quotas .
` jack rodwell and scott sinclair spent time at city but did not play a great deal , ' allardyce wrote in his evening standard column .
` the decision for a player like sinclair is would he be willing to join another club in a permanent deal if it meant less money ? '
summary: n the provided passage, Manchester City midfielder Yaya Toure has been underperforming this season, leading to criticism from manager Manuel Pellegrini. Despite this, Pellegrini has vowed to support Toure until the end of the season. It is also revealed that Manchester City will listen to offers for Toure in the summer. Manchester City is currently facing a faltering campaign and is in fifth place, with captain Vincent Kompany likely to miss the rest of the season due to a muscle injury. City goalkeeper Joe Hart has admitted that the players have underperformed and let Pellegrini down. Meanwhile, West Ham left back Aaron Cresswell is attracting interest from Manchester City and Chelsea, with Sam Allardyce warning Cresswell not to make the same mistake as other English players who moved to City and did not play a significant role.

summary: anchester City midfielder Yaya Touré has faced criticism for his underperformance this season, but manager Manuel Pellegrini has vowed to support him until the end of the season. The team is considering offers for Touré in the summer as they aim to overhaul their ageing squad. Despite Touré's two-year contract and £220,000-a-week deal, Pellegrini acknowledges his disappointment with Touré's performance. Manchester City, currently in 18th place with 18 points from the last 39 available, faces West Ham United, with defeat potentially allowing Liverpool to close the gap to one point. The team also faces the challenge of playing without captain Vincent Kompany due to a muscle injury. Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart emphasizes the need for players to take responsibility for their performances. Meanwhile, West Ham's manager Sam Allardyce has warned Aaron Cresswell, a left-back, about the potential pitfalls of moving to Manchester City.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information:

Manuel Pellegrini, Manchester City's manager, has expressed disappointment in Yaya Toure's performance this season but vowed to support him until the end of the season. Manchester City is reportedly willing to listen to offers for Toure as they look to overhaul their aging squad. Toure, who has two years left on his contract, has faced criticism amid City's faltering Premier League campaign. The team is struggling, having taken only 18 points from the last 39 available. 

Joe Hart, City's goalkeeper, stated that the players have let the manager down and should take responsibility for their poor performances. Meanwhile, Sam Allardyce, West Ham's manager, has warned Aaron Cresswell about potential interest from bigger clubs like Chelsea and Manchester City, citing examples of English players who moved to City but didn't play much, such as Jack Rodwell and Scott Sinclair.

summary: Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has expressed disappointment in Yaya Toure's performance this season but promises to support the midfielder until the end of the campaign. This comes amid reports that the club is open to selling Toure as part of a squad overhaul. Toure, on a substantial weekly wage, has faced criticism for his role in the team's recent struggles. Pellegrini, whose own future is uncertain, emphasizes that Toure remains a vital player. Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart supports Pellegrini, stating that the manager has the dressing room's backing and that players should take responsibility for their performances. Separately, West Ham manager Sam Allardyce cautions Aaron Cresswell about moving to Manchester City, citing previous English players who received limited playing time at the club.

summary:
Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has expressed disappointment in midfielder Yaya Toure's performance this season, but has vowed to support him until the end of the season. The club is expected to listen to offers for Toure in the summer as part of an overhaul of their ageing squad. Pellegrini has dismissed claims that Toure needs a rest, and has instead emphasized the midfielder's importance to the team. Meanwhile, the club is also interested in signing West Ham left back Aaron Cresswell, but Hammers manager Sam Allardyce has warned him not to make the same mistake as other English players who have struggled to get playing time at City.

pellegrini , however , said : ` the players have responsibility but i choose the players . '

allardyce believes the 25-year-old is an attractive prospect after a fine season at west ham and because he can help clubs fill homegrown player quotas .
` jack rodwell and scott sinclair spent time at city but did not play a great deal , ' allardyce wrote in his evening standard column .
` the decision for a player like sinclair is would he be willing to join another club in a permanent deal if it meant less money ? '
summary: The passage discusses Manuel Pellegrini's disappointment in Yaya Toure's performance this season. Pellegrini acknowledges that Toure has underperformed but states that he will continue to support him until the end of the season. It is revealed that Manchester City would listen to offers for Toure in the summer as they plan to overhaul their squad. The passage also mentions that Vincent Kompany could miss the rest of the season due to a muscle injury. Joe Hart, the City goalkeeper, takes responsibility for the team's poor performances and expresses support for Pellegrini. Additionally, Sam Allardyce warns Aaron Cresswell, a West Ham left back, not to make the same mistake as other English players by moving to Manchester City.

source:
manuel pellegrini has admitted he is disappointed in yaya toure but vowed to back the manchester city midfielder -- at least until the end of the season .
sportsmail revealed city would listen to offers for the ivorian as they look to overhaul an ageing squad at the end of a faltering campaign .
toure is determined not to be forced out but the chilean , speaking ahead of sunday 's visit of west ham , acknowledged the midfielder had underperformed and dismissed claims he should be given a rest .
manchester city midfielder yaya toure has come in for criticism for his performances this season
manuel pellegrini has admitted he has been disappointed by the ivory coast midfielder 's level
` i do n't think he 's happy with his performance this year -- and nor am i , ' said pellegrini .
` he does n't need a break . '
toure , who has two years left on a £ 220,000-a-week deal , has come in for criticism amid the collapse of city 's premier league defence .
but pellegrini , who faces questions over his own future , said the 31-year-old would be backed .
` he 's a very important player and he will have my support until the end of the season , ' he said .
city , who have taken just 18 points from the last available 39 , take on sam allardyce 's side knowing that defeat will leave fifth-placed liverpool with the chance to close the gap to one point with victory at west brom next weekend .
city will also face the hammers without captain vincent kompany , who could miss the rest of the campaign with a muscle injury .
with his manager in the firing line , city goalkeeper joe hart insisted the players should take responsibility .
` people have been disappointed in their own performances , ' said the england no 1 .
` we 've let the manager down a few times and we 've baffled ourselves because we feel like we 've got the quality to beat anyone and that 's not been the case . '

` he 's hard , he kind of says it how it is and you ca n't ask for much more than that from a manager . '

summary: Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini expressed disappointment in midfielder Yaya Toure's performance but pledged to support him until the season's end. Despite Toure's determination to stay, City is open to offers for him as they plan to revamp their squad. Pellegrini dismissed the idea of resting Toure, who has faced criticism during City's poor campaign. City, struggling in the league, will play West Ham without injured captain Vincent Kompany. Goalkeeper Joe Hart acknowledged the team's underperformance and support for Pellegrini. Additionally, West Ham's Sam Allardyce advised Aaron Cresswell against moving to City, citing past examples of limited playtime for English players.
